qas.question: According to democratic rules of the 106th congress what committee does minority leader chair?
According to democratic rules of the 106th congress what committee does minority leader head?
According to democratic rules of the 106th congress what campaign membership do they have?
According to democratic rules of the 106th congress what leadership members do they appoint?
What kind of responsibilities does the Policy Committee have?
Who can the Policy Committee call the meetings of?
What committee does the Policy Committee oversee?
To what council does the Policy Committee name members to?

plausible_answers.text: the Committees on Rules and House Administration

qas.question: Where can the Policy Committee nominate party members to?

context: The minority leader has a number of <b4_0>formal and informal<b4_0/> party responsibilities. Formally, the rules of each party specify certain roles and responsibilities for their leader. For example, under Democratic rules for the 106th Congress, the minority leader may call meetings of <b5_0>the Democratic Caucus<b5_0/>. He or she is a member of <b6_0>the <a2_0>Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee<b6_0/><a2_0/>; names the members of <b7_0>the <a3_0>Democratic Leadership Council<b7_0/><a3_0/>; chairs the <a0_0>Policy Committee<a0_0/>; and heads the <a1_0>Steering Committee<a1_0/>. Examples of other assignments are making "recommendations to the Speaker on all Democratic Members who shall serve as conferees" and nominating party members to <b8_0>the Committees on Rules and House Administration<b8_0/>. Republican rules identify generally comparable functions for their top party leader.
